# Curved rails on home planet placement bug

- URL: https://mods.factorio.com/mod/Warp-Drive-Machine/discussion/6843cc798f7c5599907352f5
- Thread ID: 6843cc798f7c5599907352f5
- Started by: Trollseidon

---
**Trollseidon (op):** Game seems to let you place straight rails with no concrete under it but certain curved angles it instantly deconstructs. In addition, to get around this you have to put down a sizeable extra buffer of concrete for it to place down and not instantly deconstruct.

---
**MFerrari (mod author):** I could not reproduce this... do you know what is the name of the entity ?

---
**Trollseidon (op):** In my testing to further replicate I learned of another critical item needed to reproduce the bug which is concrete. Rails at certain(?) angles/curves seem to have trouble going between un-concreted tiles and concreted tiles.

Discord image of the reproducing: <https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1071634648368676904/1381311265556660385/image.png?ex=68470ddd&is=6845bc5d&hm=5403c122094bf6a8567eebefd07b9328a08b0347c16901916c1b55292d53247e&>

I laid down my train blueprint on the left-side of the rail before I put down the concrete and it installed fine. Then I added some concrete strips and put the blueprint down again and got it to fail.

Here are some blueprints just for ease as it for sure contains angles that break:
